\u0c32\u0c15\u0c4d\u0c37\u0c23\u0c3e\u0c: In the early stage of the disease, the veins of young leafs turn light green. In the further progress a light and dark green mosaic pattern develops. The plants grow bushy and no flowers or pods are produced. The size of the leaves is decreased.
\u0c1f\u0c4d\u0c30\u0c3f\u0c17\u0c4d\u0c: The virus is transmitted through Eriophyid mite. Infection risk increases when pigeonpea is intercropped with millet or sorghum. In warm and dry periods, symptoms are suppressed.
\u0c1c\u0c40\u0c35 \u0c28\u0c3f\u0c2f\u0: Clear all plant residues of affected plants after harvesting. In an early stage you should uproot infected plants and destroy them to prevent further spreading of the virus.
\u0c30\u0c38\u0c3e\u0c2f\u0c28 \u0c28\u0: You can apply acaricides like Kelthane, Tedion @ 1 ml per liter of water to kill mites.
